name: Developer monitor by VentureGeeks
author: Nick Papanotas (@HumanWorks)

sections.description: This is probably a tool that every wordpress developer needs. Use it to see through the Firebug console all important things like database queries, $_POST, $_GET, $_FILES and other evnironment details.
sections.installation:
1. Upload dev-monitor folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Go to Settings -> Developer Monitor

short_description: Check all the running queries and other development information in Firebug. Great to debug performance issues in live web sites.
description: This is probably a tool that every wordpress developer needs. Use it to see through the Firebug console all important things like database queries, $_POST, $_GET, $_FILES and other evnironment details.

screenshots.caption: The firebug console with information on the page view.
